intro: Adenandra biseriata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenandra, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are often fragrant. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun to partial shade. Adenandra biseriata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
